author: T Madhavan
text:
Municipality begins pipe-laying work in East Tambaram and are waiting to get sanctions to lay roads

The Tambaram Municipality has finally started pipe-laying work as part of a crucial stormwater drain project to link Velachery Main Road in East Tambaram with Selaiyur lake.

Sources with Municipal Administration and Water Supply department said the construction of stormwater drains was taken up as an emergency measure in East Tambaram after the rains ceased. An elaborate network of stormwater drains, estimated to cost over Rs. 5 crore, is likely to be completed in the next two months.

Some of the roads that would get the drains are situated in wards 17, 19, 21 and 39, officials said. While the project was welcomed, residents are irked that this work, that ought to have been completed ahead of last year’s monsoon, is only getting started now.

Road widening sought

“It takes more than half-an-hour to reach Tambaram railway station from Camp Road. The work could have been taken up before the monsoon. Because of rains, it has been left-midway. Every day during rush hour, traffic on the stretch between these two places moves at a snail’s pace,” B.V. Saravanan, a resident of Rajakilpakkam, said, adding that the road along this stretch needs to be widened. Municipal officials said they are coordinating with Highways Department in this regard to get the administrative as well as financial sanctions.
title: Widen roads along with SWD work: residents
